intro: Polygala calcarea subsp. austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its morphological features, including its leaf shape and flower structure, which set it apart from other subspecies of Polygala calcarea.
